newsitem.title: UK: UK Bank shares up on forthcoming Halifax.
newsitem.headline: UK Bank shares up on forthcoming Halifax.

text.p: British banking stocks outperformed the FTSE 100 in early trading on Tuesday ahead of the forthcoming flotation of Britain's biggest mortgage lender Halifax Building Society.
"There is nothing in particular but the positive tone for the sector prevails", a trader said.

The June 2 Halifax listing has boosted the financial sector over the past few weeks as institutional investor were expected to build stakes in the Halifax, which will qualify for inclusion in the FTSE 100 upon flotation.
The Halifax on Tuesday announced that 23 percent of its flotation shares would be sold by members in the initial auction.

Shares in Barclays Plc led the banking sector, up around two percent or 23p to 12.61-1/2 stg. HSBC Holdings Plc added 1.60 percent or 28p to 18.72 stg while Abbey National Plc rose 12-1/2p to 945 by 1030 GMT.
